subtitle: Serve this pie with pickled vegetables and potato salad.

method.text: In a bowl, mix all the filling ingredients together. Set aside.
To make the pastry, combine the lard and hot water in a saucepan. Heat together gently for 2 min or until melted. Bring to the boil and remove from the heat.

Beat the flour and salt into the pastry. Then beat the egg yolk into the mixture until a soft but not sticky dough is formed. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and leave to rest in a warm place for 15 min. Do not allow the dough to cool.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Lightly grease and base line a 1 <sup>2</sup>/<sub>5</sub> litre loaf tin.
Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface. Use two thirds of the dough to line the base and sides of the lined loaf tin.
Spoon half the meat mixture into the tin followed by the hardboiled eggs. Top with the remaining meat mixture. Smooth over the surface.

Roll out the remaining pastry and use to cover the top of the pie, sealing the edges together thoroughly. Make a large hole in the centre of the pie to allow the steam to escape. Cook in the oven for 1 hour 30 min. Remove from oven and leave to cool for 3 hours.
Stir the aspic powder into the apple juice until dissolved. Leave to cool for 10 min.
Slowly pour the jelly liquid in through the hole in the top of the pie. Leave to chill for 2 - 1 days, or until jelly is set.
Remove pie from the tin. Cut into slices to serve.
